item.title: Parlement Technologiesは、右派系ソーシャルネットワークParlerをStarboardに売却することで合意し、StarboardはParlerを一時的に停止させ、再始動を計画する（Sarah E. Needleman/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Sarah E. Needleman / Wall Street Journal:
Parlement Technologies agrees to sell right-wing social network Parler to Starboard, which will take temporarily shut down Parler ahead of a planned relaunch  —  Social network popular with conservatives will be sold for an undisclosed amount and overhauled for a relaunch

item.title: センサータワー：Twitterの上位50社の広告主が過去2ヶ月間に使った金額は合計$83M、前年同期の$102Mから減少、Mars、AT&T、Volkswagenは戻ってこない（Sheila Dang/Reuters)
item.description:
Sheila Dang / Reuters:
Sensor Tower: Twitter's top 50 advertisers spent a combined $83M over the past two months, down from $102M YoY; Mars, AT&T, and Volkswagen haven't returned  —  Twitter-owner Elon Musk has said advertisers are returning to the social media platform, but statements from several companies …

item.title: 2023年3月に平均〜25Mダウンロードされ、〜5Mのリスナーを抱えるエコノミストの飄々としたポッドキャストについて、内容がより野心的になっていく様子を紹介する（Nicholas Quah/Vulture)
item.description:
Nicholas Quah / Vulture:
A look at the Economist's aloof and listenable podcasts, which averaged ~25M downloads in March 2023 and have ~5M listeners, as the content gets more ambitious  —  It's hard to argue that there's much fresh energy among news podcasts of late.  The genre's modern generation largely came …

item.title: スクリーン・オーストラリアの調査：テレビドラマ361番組のうち、4本に1本はすべてアングロ・ケルト系のメインキャスト、ファースト・ネーションのメインキャラクターは5年間で4.8％から7.2％に増加（Amanda Meade/The Guardian)
item.description:
Amanda Meade / The Guardian:
Screen Australia study: of 361 TV drama programs, 1 in 4 had entirely Anglo-Celtic main casts; First Nations main characters rose from 4.8% to 7.2% in 5 years  —  There is a lot of work still to be done to reflect Australia's population on television screens, diversity report says

item.title: カントリーミュージックやTVで活躍するTim McGrawとソーシャルコンテンツスタジオShareabilityが、Skydance Mediaが支援するナッシュビルのメディア企業Down Homeを発表（Dade Hayes/Deadline)
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Country music and TV star Tim McGraw and social content studio Shareability announce Down Home, a Nashville-based media company backed by Skydance Media  —  Down Home, as the new venture is known, will be based in Nashville.  Its activities across entertainment, media and marketing will involve McGraw …

item.title: AppleとCanal+は、フランス、フランス語圏のスイス、チェコ、スロバキアのCanal+加入者に4月20日から追加料金なしでApple TV+を提供する契約を締結（Elsa Keslassy/Variety）
item.description:
Elsa Keslassy / Variety:
Apple and Canal+ sign a deal to give Canal+ subscribers Apple TV+ in France, French-speaking Switzerland, Czechia, and Slovakia for no extra cost from April 20  —  Apple and Canal+ have signed a landmark deal that will bring Apple TV+ to all Canal+ subscribers in France, along with some other European territories.

item.title: 来週から始まるDominionとFoxの裁判で重要な「無謀な無視」の問題を検証、関係者によるとFoxは何度も和解交渉を追求したそうだ（Brian Stelter/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Brian Stelter / Vanity Fair:
Examining the key “reckless disregard” question in the Dominion-Fox trial, set to start next week; a source says Fox pursued settlement talks multiple times  —  It's time for Dominion Voting Systems to make its case against Fox News in its $1.6 billion defamation suit.

item.title: Substack CEOのChris Best氏とのQ&Aでは、Notesについて、財務の詳細を共有せずに投資を求めることなど、いくつかのコンテンツモデレーションに関する質問を回避している（Nilay Patel/The Verge）。
item.description:
Nilay Patel / The Verge:
Q&A with Substack CEO Chris Best about Notes, asking for investment without sharing financial details, and more, as he evades some content moderation questions  —  Can Substack handle the wrath of Elon Musk and the pain of content moderation?  —  It is fair to say that Substack …

item.title: ケビン・マッカーシーがFox Newsに渡した1月6日の議事堂暴動監視ビデオのコピーを求めて、New York Times、Politicoなど7社が提訴（Megan Lebowitz/NBC News）
item.description:
Megan Lebowitz / NBC News:
The New York Times, Politico, and seven other outlets sue for copies of the January 6 Capitol riot surveillance videos that Kevin McCarthy gave to Fox News  —  House Speaker Kevin McCarthy exclusively released security video from the Capitol riot to Carlson this year.

item.title: Die Zeit、Axel SpringerのCEO Mathias DöpfnerがBildを使ってドイツの最後の選挙に影響を与えようとしたこと、気候変動活動家への攻撃などを示す文章を公開（Philip Oltermann/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Philip Oltermann / The Guardian:
Die Zeit publishes texts showing Axel Springer CEO Mathias Döpfner tried to use Bild to influence Germany's last election, attacked climate activism, and more  —  Mathias Döpfner's reported comments on climate, Muslims and east Germany - and his apparent political manoeuvring - create shock waves

item.title: ComiXologyのベテラン、David Steinberger氏とChip Mosher氏が、デジタルコミックの再販マーケットプレイスを含む、印刷物とデジタルコミックの出版社、Dstlryを立ち上げる（Brian Heater/TechCrunch)
item.description:
Brian Heater / TechCrunch:
ComiXology veterans David Steinberger and Chip Mosher launch Dstlry, a print and digital comics publisher that includes a resale marketplace for digital comics  —  DSTLRY arrives with creator equity and a focus on collectability  —  Comixology was genuinely a gamechanger.

item.title: Twitchのダン・クランシーCEO、400人のスタッフ削減を擁護「サービスを存続させるために必要な措置」「クリエイターと会って悩みを解消している」（Cecilia D'Anastasio/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Cecilia D'Anastasio / Bloomberg:
Twitch CEO Dan Clancy defends cutting 400 staff, saying the move was necessary to keep the service viable, and is meeting with creators to address their worries  —  Dan Clancy, Twitch's new chief executive officer, has led projects at NASA and Google, and once wanted to look for life on Mars.

item.title: ニューヨークを拠点とする、スポーツのライブストリーミングのための通知主導型モバイルプラットフォームBuzzerは、Sapphire Sportを筆頭に$20Mを調達し、総資金額は$44M以上となった（Kim Bhasin/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Kim Bhasin / Bloomberg:
NYC-based Buzzer, a notification-driven mobile platform for streaming live sports, raised $20M led by Sapphire Sport, bringing its total funding to over $44M  —  Sports streaming startup Buzzer Media Inc. has raised new funding and entered discussions with leagues, teams and networks as it opens up the platform for licensing deals.

item.title: ロシア、ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナルのエヴァン・ガーシュコビッチ記者の囚人交換は裁判後にしか検討できないと発言、米国が釈放を求めるも (ロイター)
item.description:
Reuters:
Russia says that a prisoner swap for Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich can only be considered after a trial, despite the US pushing for his release  —  Russia said on Thursday that a possible prisoner swap involving Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich can only be considered …

item.title: InsiderはAIを取り入れる方法をテストするグループを結成する予定、EICは個人の記事にAI利用についての開示を入れる予定はないと述べている（Sara Fischer/Axios）。
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Insider plans to form a group to test ways to incorporate AI; the EIC says the outlet doesn't plan to include disclosures about using AI on individuals articles  —  Insider plans to begin experimenting with ways to leverage AI in its journalism, its global editor-in-chief Nicholas Carlson told Axios.
